channel.title: Sun java Vs ms vm
channel.description:
I only just noticed that 'default java' is no longer the recomended java type on the detail select page.
surely microsoft java couldnt have all the extra problems faced in using the sun java version? or are they the same compilation?

item.title: Sun java Vs ms vm
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Ms java also does not support swing, not that’s relavent to RS. Anyway, it’s the same compilation. Jagex just compiles all their code to a specified jdk version (1.1) so it runs of everything. I don’t know about it being discontinued, since it comes standard with IE I believe, and that’s not going to change…

Read full topic

item.title: Sun java Vs ms vm
item.dc:creator: @Dodian Dodian
item.description:
@Dodian wrote:

Yeah it’s odd, 1.1 is way back from 1999 I believe…

Read full topic

item.title: Sun java Vs ms vm
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

yea, i think it is 1.1, so it would be much simpler? =\

but since it is going to be discontinued next year, it wouldnt be worthwhile persuing anything along these lines?

Read full topic

item.title: Sun java Vs ms vm
item.dc:creator: @Dodian Dodian
item.description:
@Dodian wrote:

Ms java is much older (1.1 I think) and is due to be discontinued officially in 2007. It was ruled illegal.

Read full topic
